title: Following A Dream
opening: Though showing brief signs of recovery, even Rhea's strength has its limits. Having changed form to The Immaculate One, she is unable to control her power. As if in Response, priests and knights who are directly related to Rhea by blood change into White Beasts themselves. Facing this unexpected threat, the resistance army prepares for its final battle to save Fódlan.

With Shambhala in ruins, the five-year war is finally at an end and a new age of peace has arrived. Not long for this world, Rhea wishes to discuss Fódlan's future with you/you. But all is not well...

dialogue.speaker: Manuela
dialogue.line: That's a serious injury… It's a miracle that she's even alive right now. I'll do what I can, but…

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Five years ago, when this place fell an enormous white creature appeared on the battlefield. It was the Immaculate One... Rhea.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: What? You already knew Rhea's true identity?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I see. In the past the children of the goddess were all able to change their appearance, just like the Immaculate One. I lost that power long ago, but it seems Rhea has not.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You're one of the children of the goddess?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Is it not obvious? Flayn and I both are. We have protected Garreg Mach, and all of Fódlan, for a very long time. But now... the light of Rhea's life is on the verge of disappearing from this world. It is flickering... I do not know if she can be saved. Even if she is, I wonder if she will remain unchanged...

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Professor. Are you able to carry on Rhea's work. As the protector of Fódlan and as leader of the people who live here... You must defend the people. Guide them and teach them. Join their hearts and spread peace across the whole of the land.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: It is not as though you must become the archbishop. But Fódlan needs leadership it is up to you to govern this war-torn land.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: You need not reply right this moment. We will strive to heal Rhea as best we can.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Perhaps it would help to seek counsel from our friends at the monastery about this matter.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I agree. When your mind is made up, please speak with me. I would ask that you give me your decision in the presence of Rhea herself.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Well done, Professor. We have brought the war to a magnificent conclusion. The Empire, Alliance, and Kingdom are no more. Nor are there any factions that could blindside us and cause conflict. Now it falls to us to rule Fódlan, and bring about an era of peace and prosperity. You would be a fine choice for the first ruler of this new era. I sincerely believe that.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: So, your heart is already set on it! Excellent! In that case, congratulations are in order.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Well, if you are unsure, what does that say about everybody else's chances?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I will follow you, Professor. I aim to be a great and respectable noble.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Congratulations on a job well done, Professor. I do hope Lady Rhea is well? Is it true what I heard? You will be taking over her post? Would that make you archbishop? Or higher still? Am I in the company of the future ruler of Fódlan?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Either would be a hassle.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I agree! Imagine all that responsibility. Until now, you've always fought with all of us by your side. Bring ruler would be a much lonelier job, though I am certain you would excel.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The latter. I will rule over Fódlan.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: So you've already decided... Such proactive thinking is the hallmark of a good ruler.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Me? I have no interest in a leadership role. I'm happy to spend the rest of my days studying...and napping.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: All... RIGHT! We did it, Professor! We really gave it to 'em out there! With all the fighting and hardships, I don't know how we did it... But I'm glad we made it through together!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Me too.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Now all we gotta do is make you the new ruler! That's gonna be a fun coronation!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It was a lot to push through.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Sorry if I made your life more difficult! None of that matters anymore though, right? Now all we gotta do is make you the new ruler! That's gonna be a fun coronation!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Phew... It's all over, Professor. Though I am worried about Lady Rhea... But still, Fódlan is united, and those terrible people lurking in the dark have finally been destroyed. Looks like it's the dawn of a wonderful new era...of blissful seclusion for Bernie!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That won't do.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Wh-what? Why not?! Hey, that better not be your first official decree! You're going to ask for my help again, aren't you? Oh, why?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Suit yourself.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Woo-hoo! You finally did it, Bernie! Now take your reward of eternal peace and quiet!

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Finally! An end to the fighting. Have you ever felt happier? I've worried that I might not live to see this day, but here we are, and everything is going to be OK, isn't it? Huh, my heart feels like it's ready to burst. I'm so full of happiness, yet I feel a sense of loss too...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We did lose a lot.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Yes, we certainly did. But we managed to keep a great many things safe, as well.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We protected more than we lost.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I agree. I suppose if I think of those who are gone as the people who ensured our freedom...it hurts less.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Please do what you can to keep the peace, so we never have to face such awful times again.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: War has been ended. I will now be returning to Brigid. I hope in the new Fódlan, Brigid can be accepted with friendship. When my professor becomes the leader, I think that will have a possibility. Please, choose well.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Same to you.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Yes. Now I must be packing.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure yet...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Is that the truth? I will be waiting for your decision. I will be packing while you are thinking.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: It's over. What will you do? I heard you intend to lead.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: You shouldn't need that long to decide. Make up your mind.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm more interested in what you'll do.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Well, if you do choose to lead, I might like to work for you. But first, I'll go back to the old Faerghus territory. Where my father and my old friends once lived. I need to pay respects, put flowers on their graves.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Well, it took a long while for us to get here, but we did it. The war is finally over. We've been through a lot together, haven't we? Let me just say, it's truly been an honor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The same to you.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I'm flattered to hear you say do.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Oh, cut it out.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Hey, come on, I mean it! There's nothing to be embarrassed about!

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: For whatever it's worth, I think you'd make a great monarch, and I'd support you every step of the way.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ah, yow! She didn't have to slap me that hard. Oh, Professor, it's you. What's up? Need something?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Lover's quarrel again?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I dunno if I'd call us lovers, exactly. Not yet anyway. It's was just a dinner invite.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't need anything, but...

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Heh, you worried I might cause trouble again? Nah, I just invited a girl out to dinner.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: All fighting and no loving makes Sylvain a rusty boy. Well, I can get back in practice now. Peacetime is the best for love--nobody dying, nobody getting hurt...except me, apparently. If you're gonna be the ruler, you need to keep the peace going so I can catch up on my love life.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I heard a rumor that you're going to take over for Lady Rhea!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It hasn't been decided.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Oh, so the rumor was really true? I hope you accept. I don't think there's anyone else who could do it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's the plan.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: So it's already been decided? That's very admirable of you, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: You have nothing to worry about. We're here to help you if you need anything at all! We'll support you no matter what path you choose to follow!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Is Lady Rhea OK? She was quite weakened to start, and then she took all those heavy injuries... I don't want to imagine it, but what will happen if Lady Rhea passes away like this?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll cross that bridge if we come to it.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I suppose you're right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm sure she'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Yes. I'm praying every day that she'll get well as soon as possible.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Anyhow... You're going to be the ruler, Professor? It's so strange to think of, for some reason!

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Can it really be? Are we truly at peace? To think that my days will not be spent debating war tactics and preparing for battles. It doesn't quite feel real. Now that we are finally at peace, I'm not quite sure what to do with myself.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Just take it easy.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: That sounds...challenging for how easy it must actually be.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe you should think about the future now.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Thinking of the future has never been my forte.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: As long as I have a routine in place for myself, I can find contentment.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: The day is ours, Professor. And this victory will ensure our names are immortalized in history. Or perhaps this is but the opening chapter in the tale they will write of our glory. After all, if you are to rule this reunited land, surely there is bound to be a place for me at your side?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Absolutely.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: I read your mind, didn't I? Fear not! I will not fail to rise to the occasion!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Nothing's decided yet.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Is that so? It seems to me that everyone has already assumed you would take the position.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Regardless, your decision will have an impact on my future, so be sure to make it a good one!

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! I was just thinking I might go train. I know the war's over, but that doesn't mean I can stop working my muscles!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That makes sense.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I'm glad you see it my way! I always knew you were a smart one!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You should work on other things too.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Really? I wouldn't know where to start, but...

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: There's no harm in keeping up with my training!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: After all that's happened to Lady Rhea, all of the stuff with Solon and the others, and everything that's happened with you, Professor... There's still a lot I don't understand. Please teach me, Professor--everything you know, everything you've learned.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: OK.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Thank you, oh thank you!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: If I get the chance...

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: If it's at all possible, I hope you'll speak about it not just to me, but to everyone else as well. I think everyone should know what happened here. If we're going to build a new, united Fódlan...that's absolutely crucial.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Those who slither in the dark will never harm anyone again. They're finally done for. Thank you, Professor. Finally, I feel some vindication for what I've gone through.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No, thank you, Lysithea.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Ah, Professor. Ever the modest one. I do like that aspect of you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Keep up the good work.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Uh, sure thing.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: As long as I'm of use here, I'm happy to stick around, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: And with that, we can finally enjoy a time of peace. I'm honored to have fought by your side. Even if you haven't made plans yet, I know you'll do your best, whatever your future may hold.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You've grown much stronger.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: If true, that's all thanks to you and our allies.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You've become quite the optimist.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I never would've dreamed my heart could have grown this way.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Please let me know if there's anything more I can do.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! The war is finally, really, definitely over now, right? We're not gonna find out there was some evil shadowy figure hiding behind the subterranean guys, are we?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Who knows.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Well, whatever. No matter what comes, I know we can triumph in the end!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't think so.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Ah, that's good! Though to be honest, there's not much that would surprise me at this point...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I feel invincible! A nice perk of being your student, don't you think?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Well, we both made it. And we avenged Jeralt too. Can't say it gets any better than that. You've got a lot of work ahead of you, I hear. People want you to govern, don't they?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's a hassle.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Yeah. Sadly, this isn't the kind of burden I can take off your hands.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's a dilemma.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Well, at the end of the day, it's your decision. Just take your time. Think it through.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: You've got to consider it carefully, so you don't have any regrets. Whatever you choose, though, just know that I'm here for you.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: We did it, Captain!

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Make sure you've got no regrets.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: At last, the day is upon us. The captain would be pleased. Don't you think, Leonie?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Definitely. And he'd be proud of the professor too.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: It seems like our efforts have been rewarded. It was certainly a long, difficult struggle to get here.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: It was. Oh, Jeralt... We worked so hard for this.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Uh, hello?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Whaaaaaah!

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Aaah! How long have you been standing there?!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Er, ahem. Whether or not you choose to succeed Lady Rhea, we will forever be by your side.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Yeah. We'll be here no matter what you decide. But make sure you think it through. You don't want to have any regrets.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Well? Is your mind made up?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I understand. Just know that we are applying all our power right now toward healing Rhea. You should take this opportunity to speak with everyone. I am certain it will do you good.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Yes

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: I have faith in Lady Rhea's convalescence, but even so, what she needs now is rest. And while she is recovering, somebody must watch over Fódlan. There is no one more fit to wear such a mantle than you, Professor. That is what I believe. I do not doubt the others feel the same.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Shambhala... An underground city with an entirely different lineage than the goddess? Strange phenomena, driven by a source totally alien to the Crests that we understand. Most unsettling! Could it be magic? Some manner of technology? I would like to know the truth of it all. Very much so. I want to know their history, their knowledge. Why do you suppose they chose this place to occupy?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Well, I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: No, I suppose you wouldn't... It seems we will have to excavate Shambhala to know more. Although, I heard you will be the Ruler here? Should I ask your permission to proceed with the dig?

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Life can be tough, you know? But if you've got your friends to help you through, it can be a lot easier. Maybe you butt heads sometimes...but that's OK. That's how you build bonds, right? And I've got friends, Professor. Plenty of those. It's true love that seems to have passed me by.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You should relax.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Relax? I'm relaxed.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: There's still hope.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: But where is my true love to be found? Where is my ray of hope?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Time to give up?

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Yeah… I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Jeralt... We've done it. We've finally brought this creaky old ship ashore. The fight was long and bitter, but finally...I can lay down my burden.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Uh, hello?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Whaaaaah! It's you! Don't creep up like a ghost. Next time, announce yourself. Er, ahem. Whether or not you choose to succeed Lady Rhea, I will forever be by your side. You should live your life however you want. That's what the captain would say, I think.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Lady Rhea stopped the forces that threatened to destroy Fódlan. She's trying to realize her own dream of peace. Isn't that enough? Can't you let her rest? If you're the only person who's fit to replace her, you should just do it. I'm sure Lady Rhea wishes for that too, right? I can't think of anyone who's more well suited to the job.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: The war's finally over... I have to admit, even I got a little emotional. Rhea's condition doesn't look good. There's nothing to do now but wait. More importantly, are you serious about becoming Fódlan's new ruler?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: It's pretty sudden. Either way, do what you think is best.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I am.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: You made up your mind pretty quickly. Either way, do what you think is best.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Professor, do you figure Lady Rhea will be OK? She will, won't she? I don't care one bit who'll succeed Lady Rhea, 'cause nobody's gonna need to. She's gonna be happy and healthy again. You'll see.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: I can tell that things will settle down soon enough. Gotta get back to slinging wares and making moolah! And hopefully no more messes to spoil it after this...

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Say, how is the archbishop faring? The soldiers and citizens are all concerned! Just when we thought peace had finally arrived... What's to become of Fódlan?

intro.speaker: Rhea
intro.line: Sweet child... You have finally come... I am so happy. It does my heart well to see you here, safe and sound.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Have you made your decision, professor? Thankfully, Rhea has survived her trying ordeal. However... There is no telling how much longer her light will continue to shine.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Professor, have you decided? Will you become the next ruler of Fódlan?

intro.speaker: Rhea
intro.line: Before I hear your answer, I shall fulfill the promise I made to you. You will know the truth about your identity... I will hold nothing back. I... created you. And within you is the crest stone of the progenitor god... I hid the crest stone within your heart in order to revive her. Sweet child... I am sorry. I wanted to see her... see my mother... even if it meant doing that which is forbidden.

intro.speaker: Rhea
intro.line: I thought that I could regain all I had lost, if only I could revive my mother... And so I tried to bring her back by creating a body, and then burying a crest stone within it. A young woman I created... my twelfth try after much heartache... was a failure. She grew up lacking the conscience of the progenitor God and fell in love with the captain of the Knights of Seiros. In time, she became pregnant... but she and the child were not able to survive the birth. The child she bore was not breathing, and she herself was in grave danger. The new mother pleaded with me to take the crest stone of the progenitor god from her own body and place it within the baby. If I had done nothing, both mother and child would have died. And so I granted her final wish. As she had hoped, the baby started breathing again... The new life was saved. Your life, sweet child.

intro.speaker: Rhea
intro.line: Well before that, I had saved Jeralt's life using the power of my blood. That means you are the child of a mother born of the progenitor God's crest stone and a father who carried my own blood. I knew, deep in my heart, that you would be capable of housing the conscience of the progenitor god. I was right... And yet, she merely gifted her power to you and then disappeared once more. My dearest wish did not come true… but here you are. You alone wield the power of the progenitor God. And now, I must ask you to use that power to save this world. You must...

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: What is wrong? Please calm yourself, Rhea!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Is the power of the crest taking over her body? Why is this happening?!

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: Seteth! It's terrible! White beasts have appeared all over Garreg Mach! It's hard to believe, but there have been reports that the priests and Knights have been changing form.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: White beasts... Are they the ones Rhea shared her blood and stones with?

intro.speaker: Church Soldier
intro.line: Seteth! Demonic beasts are heading this way!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: They are after Rhea... Professor, our situation is dire. If we do nothing, Fódlan will be destroyed by a rampaging Immaculate One and these children of hers. There is only one way to stop this. We... we must... Damn it! We have no choice but to kill the Immaculate One... to kill Rhea!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: It is kept secret, but there is a certain rite that all initiates to high office in the church must undergo. In this rite, one pledges to serve the goddess and in return, receives a Crest Stone fragment and blood. The ones who have transformed alongside Rhea just now are the ones who have accepted those gifts. They will shield Rhea--the Immaculate One, I should say--with their very lives. But if we do not strike her down, Fódlan will have no future. To arms!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Surrounded already, it seems. The White Beasts are those in whom Rhea's blood flows strongest. Until we get rid of them, we will not be able to so much as touch Rhea.

battle.speaker: Caspar
battle.line: Damn. After all that's happened...why do we have to kill Lady Rhea?

battle.speaker: Bernadetta
battle.line: Isn't the fighting already over?! Why do we have to do this to Lady Rhea?!

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: The Immaculate One. We cannot afford to lose here, whoever our foe may be!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Stop! Any damage to the Immaculate One will only be transferred to those beasts.

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: It is seeming that my understanding of Fódlan tradition is...insufficient. What is happening?

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: It is too dangerous to approach her now. Capture the southern stronghold first to seal the beasts away!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: They're coming one by one from the southern stronghold. If we do not capture it, there will be more.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Let us turn our attention to the Immaculate One.

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: This is it. The final battle.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Rhea?! Not even I have seen this form!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: Well, that's something, isn't it? A shame we must kill her. Consider the research potential...

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: I will inherit the pride of Nabatea. Rest in peace by Sothis's side!

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: Rhea... How tragic. But there is no time to waste. She must be stopped!

boss.speaker: Catherine
boss.line: Lady Rhea... With my sword, I will put an end to your suffering.

boss.speaker: Cyril
boss.line: This is me, paying ya back. No matter what, I'll stop Lady Rhea!

narration: A rising flame was alight as the flow of time carved a new history for Fódlan. Rhea's wild rampage was put to an end, averting what could have the greatest crisis in the history of Fódlan After five and a half years of war, a new age was set to begin. The Empire, Kingdom, and Alliance—all political structures that had once shaped the continent—were gone. A unified nation began to take shape under the watchful eye of the Church of Seiros. The church's new leader became a champion of the people, working tirelessly to help them overcome the horrors of war and to carve a path towards reconstruction. Just as Saint Seiros tended to those who suffered in wars of the past, Fódlan's new ruler embraced their role as mother of all life and arbiter of every soul.
